name: Beautiful oasis of plants & art @ best location
description:
An ideal Hong location any visitor--hip without being touristy--this contemporary & newly renovated 1 bedroom apartment has every feature you need for your stay, from a stereo and internet to cooking needs and warm lighting. Enjoy!

The space
Filled with plants and art, this one bedroom urban oasis has been newly renovated and impeccably re-decorated -- warm and inviting in the best of neighborhoods for your stay in Hong Kong. The art comes from local and regional artists all over Asia and the art & coffee table books are there for your enjoyment during your stay. The custom built desks provide ample working space. A fold out table is adjacent to the kitchen for dining.

Before reading further, please kindly note: for those who do not have any or many AirBnB reviews, I do require an full introduction of who you are as this is my personal place. Also, as this is an AirBnB and not a hotel and I do not charge a cleaning fee, I do politely ask it to be ret
neighborhood_overview: In the upper part of trendy, hip Sheung Wan, within walking distance to all -- a very central and ideal location.   Next to the famous Man Mo Temple and also near many of the the trendiest restaurants in town. Easy walking distance to Central for meetings and a 5 minute walk to the MTR subway system.
host_about:
I've been with AirBnB now for many years, often having guests stay at my apartment in the midst of it all in Hong Kong (and now in the heart of Williamsburg, Brooklyn) and feel that hosting is a true pleasure. I like to receive guests as if they were friends, as we're all travellers at heart. 

I'm an American fine art photographer and I travel often, so would like to offer my place to you while I am not there.  I keep them both clean, stylized and comfortable so you'll feel more at home.

I travel often and often remotely so sometimes it takes a couple days for me to respond but as long as I have wifi I'll get back to you immediately. 

If you are interested, I would be delighted to provide more information about myself directly to you. So please just ask!

description:

Located on Hollywood Road, walking distance to MTR station and Bar and party District Lan Kwai Fong, this apartment to yourself, has wireless internet, cable TV, DVD Player, full bathroom with enclosed newly remodeled shower, 1 double sized bed and one single pullout sofa bed and open kitchen area with and electric cooker.

It is close to all sorts of transportation that take you to everywhere you would want to go to in Hong Kong. It is 5 minutes of walking to the Central MTR Station and very close to the foreign friendly district Soho (South of Hollywood Rd). Also, there are 7 Eleven convenient stores near by. There's a full bath with shower. It is on the top floor of the building and there are 2 working elevators. In the area, you will find banks, bus stops, tram stops, subway stops, supermarkets, convenient stores and laundry mats all within walking distance from the building. A few minutes walk away from the harbour front and the fantastic Sun Yat Sun Memorial Park and Public swimming pool over look the world famous Victoria Harbor.

name: Soho off Hollywood Road P4
description:
Fun Fact: Possession St, is where the British first landed when they arrived in Hong Kong in 1841, Thus the St Name.
This nice 2 bedroom apartment sits at the intersection of old and new Hong Kong. New Bars & restaurants line Hollywood Rd steps away. The apartment is located in a traditional walk up Hong Kong building to the forth floor, no elevator.

The space
Located in the most convenient spot in Hong Kong, it is close to everything and everywhere you would want to or need to go to in Hong Kong. Next to the Sheung Wan MTR Subway station, 7 Eleven, Bank of China, HSBC, Supermarkets, computer center, Sheung Wan produce market, bars, coffee shops, night clubs, main tram station, bus stations (over 30 different bus routes that stop here). Crossing street is Hollywood Road, the foreign friendly district located in Soho, walking distance to the big and beautiful Hollywood Park with fish ponds and beautiful plants and trees. And also close by is Upper Lascar Row
neighborhood_overview: Fantastic traditional Hong Kong neighborhood with lots of history at every street alley and corner.  Local restaurants are a treat to experience and public transport is all around to get you to all places of the city.

name: Creative Residence in Yau Ma Tei
description:
Shanghai Street Studios (SSS) have a private room for creative people in Yau Ma Tei.

SSS is located on the third floor of a 1960's walk up apartment ("tong lau") and functions as a creative space for projects that engage with the local community and neighbourhood.

The space
The apartment is equipped with many amenities including a kitchen, air conditioning, washing machine, powerful hot shower, Wi-Fi, an iron, hairdryer, towels, slippers and a nice space that lets in the sunlight (corner apartment windows).

We have a library that includes books ranging from Yukio Mishima novels to zines collected from all over the world. The room has some great and non-touristic maps, with fictional stories based in Hong Kong for that encounter with jet-lag.

Please note that SSS is relatively noisy at night but we hope that this adds to your cultural experience. Ear plugs come with the room.

The neighbourhood:

- Friendly an
neighborhood_overview: We'll let you discover the neighbourhood : )
host_about:
Shanghai Street Studios was founded by Hong Kong photographer Martin Cheung and local designer and beekeeper Michael Leung.

Michael and Martin met each other in Hong Kong in 2009. They worked on a HK Honey project together and founded Shanghai Street Studios in July 2011.

name: Bright Studio - Soho - Central HK
description:
Our bright studio apartment is perfect for visiting Hong Kong Island.
Located on a quiet street 10 minutes walk from Soho and the escalator and with all the amenities you need its a perfect space for you to relax after seeing the sights.

The space
Serviced studio apartment in the Centre of Hong Kong in a very quiet street. Only 5 minutes walk from Staunton Street and the Escalator in Soho.

Bright and comfortable with all the amenities you need for both a short trip and a longer stay.

TV and sofa with and Apple TV for those with itunes accounts and DVD player and selection of DVDs. Aircon and fan for the Summer months and a heater for the Winter.

Comfortable double bed and a full kitchen with oven, fridge and microwave should you feel the urge to stay in and cook. Regular cleaning is included (normally Monday and Thursday). Real coffee is also ready for you along with a few basics to get you started.

Spare
neighborhood_overview: The local neighbourhood is quiet and relaxing.  There is a small park nearby along with a great bakery and coffee shops.  The centre of the city is only a few minutes walk away from this peaceful place.
host_about:
Hi Everyone,

my Wife and I have this little apartment for friends and family which we let to travelers to Hong Kong when its free.  

We like to look after people and ensure that they enjoy their stay in Hong Kong.  We have someone who will visit every other day to keep the place clean and tidy.  

We can arrange travel cards, maps and local SIMs for you upon arrival if you need and will meet you at the door or provide a self check in option depending on your needs.

We will be available on the phone during your stay to help with whatever you need and make sure that you enjoy your stay.  If you need an unlocked phone for your stay we are happy to lend you one.

The apartment is 5 minutes walk from Soho and the Elevator and it puts you right in the middle of the main bar/restaurant area of Hong Kong Island.  You will not want to spend much time in the apartment as everything is so close by.  However, for those days when you just want to sit and relax though we have a pile of DVDs and can lend you a few games if you need.

And, if you are a sailor, we are members of the RHKYC and can make some introductions if you want.

hope to see you in Hong Kong soon.

Darren and Annalisa

host_location: Mid-level, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
host_about:
Hi!

I moved to Hong Kong with all my family in September 2011.

I am French, my wife is Indian and we have a marvellous (but sometimes naughty) 3-year old daughter.
We are both working in Hong Kong but we usually have to go abroad for business trips/holidays.

We have been discovering the city since more than 6 months now and we have been amazed by the diversity of this place: a city full of energy...and of people, lost and lovely beaches less than 30 minutes away from downtown, many malls of course but also some museums and art gallerys as well as tons of basketball courts!

I am inded found of basketball. And what a pleasure to get out of our place, walk a few minutes and play on a lovely playground along the bay at night!

Cheers.

Arnaud

name: Apartment located in Stanley, H.K.
description:
The space
It is a studio / designer flat with double bed, toilet, bathroom. It located in Stanley.

Stanley is a town and a tourist attraction in Hong Kong. It located on a peninsula on the southeastern part of Hong Kong Island. It is east of Repulse Bay and west of Shek O, adjacent to Chung Hom Kok. Administratively, it is part of the Southern District.

Stanley has many bars and restaurants on its waterfront along Stanley Main Street.

Stanley is famous for its two beaches: Stanley Main Beach, located on the eastern side of the peninsular, and St. Stephen's Beach, on the western side. Both beaches are sandy and have areas designed for barbecues. Like many beaches in Hong Kong, they also have netted perimeters to protect swimmers from sharks.

It is located 3 mins to Stanley Market
1 mins to beach side walk
1 mins to Murray House
1 mins to Tin Hau Temple
1 mins to bars and restaurants.
2 mins to Stanley Plaza

The space
A great offer for this fabulous location near mid levels.

This Open Studio offers a large comfy double bed, FREE Wifi, hair dryer, large LCD TV with entertainment DVD system. The building has an elevator direct to the apartment with just a few steps to the lobby area.

Located on Third Street in a laid back area and has rapidly become a hip area hosting many of the city's most creative types, it takes 5 minutes/$3 USD cab ride or 15 minutes by foot to Central. There is a 7-11 convenience store just across the street. The area is a melting pot of East meets West, with older chinese traditional buildings being surrounded by high end new luxurious developments with new restaurants, nice coffee shops, banki
neighborhood_overview: The Sheung Wan neighbourhood is ever changing and a fantastic mix of "old' and "new" Hong Kong.  This apartment is located in the heart of Hong Kong's commercial, cultural and shopping districts and within short walking distance to the subway and HK Macau Ferry Pier.  A few minutes walk away from the harbour front and the fantastic Sun Yat Sun Memorial Park and Public swimming pool over look the world famous Victoria Harbor.
host_about:
I've enjoyed traveling to different parts of the world my entire life and absolutely love meeting locals at each place I visit to get first hand knowledge of the destination.  I've made many friends across the globe and look forward to visiting them each time I'm back in the region.  I've called Hong Kong my home for the past 30 years, this is absolutely a brilliant little place with so much local flavor and western influences in this Chinese city.  I look forward to meeting lots of overseas friends and pointing out the many local favorites so every visitor has a chance to experience the best of this great city.
Happy travels!
amenities: ["Air conditioning", "Microwave", "Kitchen", "Heating", "Hot water", "Elevator", "Stove", "Dishes and silverware", "TV", "Wifi", "Refrigerator", "Cable TV"]

name: High floor/Bay view in Kowloon !!
description:
The space
SPECIAL NOTE:
As everyone knows about the ongoing political situation in Hong Kong, I would like to inform prospective guests, in general, there are no more protests in the city. Everything is pretty much fine and calm and running smoothly, as normal.
But if you have any specific questions regarding the matter, I will be glad to guide you to the best of my knowledge and ability.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BEFORE YOU BOOK, PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU READ ALL SECTIONS OF THE LISTING PROPERLY (esp. the House Rules) SO YOU ARE AWARE OF WHAT IS PROVIDED/ALLOWED, AND WHAT IS NOT.

Once you have read through properly, only then decide whether you want to book or not. Once you make the booking it is assumed you have read and understood and agree to everything.

Any confusion or questions, ask me, I am more than happy to answer them. (:
----------------
host_about:
I have lived in HK and the US pretty much my whole adult life and for the last few years have been shuttling between the two countries for family reasons. When I'm in HK, depending on my length of stay, I rent out my spare room, and when I am out of HK I rent it out as a one bedroom.

 
I am a hybrid of sorts..(in my mental make-up, rather than genetically)! I like to see myself as a citizen of the world! However if I were to pin it down, I'd say I'm a "New Yorker" at heart! As my favorite artist of all time Billy Joel once sang, "I'm in a New York state of mind.." immortalizing that city and my feelings more poetically than I ever could.

I'm a very artistically inclined person, interested in photography, documentaries,  and writing, that includes articles, short stories and poems. I've worked in the Hospitality industry my whole life with brief stints in other fields. Currently I work on a freelance basis for various orgs and non profits.
Traveling and adventure is in my blood. Meeting people from various countries is a passion I've always had. I have traveled myself to over 20 countries and in some cases have lived in the homes of people just like family and turned them into life long friends!

name: Mixed Dorm Bed#1/Wan Chai/close to MTR
description:
My place is close to everything travelers want. Youâ€™ll love my place because of the coziness, the comfy bed, and the views. Friendly staff is guaranteed. The China Visa Office is a block away!

The space
The hostel is located at the most convenient spot you can find. We are well connected to every part of HK. Tram, buses, MTR and Ferries are all available modes of transport from our hostel. Our staff are friendly and experienced and always willing to run the extra mile to make your stay an enjoyable one. For guests who need a visa run, we are next to many embassy offices, e.g. China Visa Office, Vietnam Embassy. We are also close to the IELTS exam centre and Hong Kong Convention & Exhibition centre.

Guest access
Guests are most welcome to use the air conditioned common areas anytime. The common area on the Reception Floor is new and comfy. There are smaller common areas on each floor as well.

Other things to note
There
neighborhood_overview: Wan Chai is for foodies! Why? Just look at the number of Michelin restaurants we have in our neighbourhood. Wan Chai is also an area with local colour (e.g. Blue House, Tai Yuen Street) but connected to the international part of HK, e.g. Central, Causeway Bay.
host_about:
Check Inn HK is located in the heart of Hong Kong Island. The hostel is well connected to most tourist spots and is close to metro stations. Check Inn HK is also the ideal place for tourists who come to HK for China Visa. Our hostel is just 5-min walk from the office.

Check Inn HK is a family-run hostel which aims to provide you the best hostel experience. Our friendly and well-trained staff is always ready to give you information about Hong Kong and China. We also provide a list of free service for our guests, to name just a few, iron, wifi, computers, hair dryer, adapter.

Check Inn HK is also a place for people who like to make new friends. As the hostel is a small one, guests find it easy to chat with each other in the cosy lounge area. Our staff regularly organizes dim sum gatherings and hiking activities for guests who have a taste other than shopping and drinking.

Check Inn HK, a place you could call it home.

name: Grand convenient studio! (C)
description:
The space
This studio equipped everything you need for travel!

The double bed is comfortable for two people
There is a kitchen for simple food and all utensils
Private bathroom and not sharing with anyone

You cannot find a place with better location.
Just right next to Causeway Bay MTR& the famous Sogo Department store
Only 5 mins walk to the Victoria Park.
Very convenient to everywhere in Hong Kong.

The studio is spacious and is definitely suitable for long stay as well

It is nicely furnished with good quality home applicants.
Hope you enjoy the stay. You won't regret from staying here, Great deal for a great price, forget those expensive hotel that gives you fancy delight yet it would add up to your spending, Grab a great deal where you can truly enjoy your vacation without spending too much and gives you the "homey feel"
host_about: Hi, my name is Alfred! I live in Hong Kong where is a funny east meet west place! I like to make friends with people all around the world! I have few cool places in HK for your options. Feel Free to check it out! Please make yourself at home!

name: Modern family-friendly suite in fishing village
description:
Our property is located in Tai O on Lantau Island, Hong Kong's largest and most unspoiled outlying island. Lantau is an off-track destination for those who look to escape to an alternative Hong Kong.

Tai O itself is a charming, traditional fishing village. We offer a comfortable home away from home so that guests can have time to explore and appreciate the crude beauty which is not possible to be found in downtown Hong Kong.

The space
Our Family Suite is on the first floor. The room has a balcony with a view to Tai Chung.

Room facilities include:
Warm and cool air-conditioning, two single twin beds sized 92cm x 190cm, one day-bed (bed for two, with two mattresses of 195 cm x 98 cm each);
Sitting area with 32" LED television and chaise longue;
Ensuite bathroom with rain shower, hairdryer and bathroom amenities;
Room size: 350 sq.ft. approximately
Balcony size: 64 sq.ft.

Other things to note
Ou
neighborhood_overview: Tai O villagers still lead a simple life. Unlike the urban fellow citizens, folks here are used to getting up very early and enjoy morning tea in the convivial atmosphere of local teahouses or â€œcha chaan tengâ€. Local restaurants serve the last call around 8 pm and are usually closed by 9 pm. Late night dining is only possible in a handful of small eateries. There are no chain supermarkets, convenient stores and fast food joints. Visitors will truly enjoy tranquility here though some conveniences have to be compromised. No vehicles are allowed beyond the parking area/ bus terminus/ taxi stand.
host_about:
Hi, I am Veronica, your host at Espace Elastique, and I am ready to greet you in Cantonese, Putonghua, English, franÃ§ais, suomi y un poquito espaÃ±ol.

Espace Elastique (pronounced É›spas elastic) consists of a B&B, boutique hotel style accommodation and a cafÃ¨ in Tai O on Lantau Island, Hong Kong's largest and most unspoiled outlying island. Lantau is an off-track destination for those who look to escape to an alternative Hong Kong.

"Being elegantly simple" is our attitude. Our company's mission is to help sustain Tai O's crude beauty by offering our guests a comfortable home from home so that they will have time to explore and appreciate this charming traditional fishing village.

name: Budget Studio1-5p Tsim Sha Tsui MTR
description:
Cozy Open Studio Apt for 1-5 persons: with free Wifi
40 mins ride by Cityflyer bus A21 from HKIA to our place.
We are at 4/F. and the building is with elevator
-1 double bed 4.5 x 6.5ft
-1 sofa bed 4.2 x 6.5ft
-1 open kitchen (Basic cooking utensils are provided for simple cooking)
-1 bathroom (separate shower and toilet)
- Floor mattress will be provided for the 5 guest

If you have more than 5 persons, pls go to check our other apt. which has 3 rooms and 3 bathrooms pls visit this web with more pictures and information:
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/412406


Location :
- 1 minute walk to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station (Exit A).
- 1 minute walk to Tsim Sha Tsui MTR station( Exit C1)
- 1 minute walk to Kowloon Mosque And Islamic Centre
- next to Isquare shopping mall
- 2 minutes walk to Park Lane Shopper's Boulevard
- 2 minutes walk to Kowloon Park
- 5 minutes walk to the Star Ferry
host_about: Hi, I am from Hong Kong. I like watching the drama! I have two Chihuahua "Barbie" & "Sweetie" and I love Chihuahua very much! My favorite movie is "Titanic" I like to meet people from all over the world through Airbnb and have had wonderful experiences and friendships through Airbnb.! If you are budget traveler or in a tight budget , pls tell me and maybe I can offer you a good rate to stay!

name: Special offer! 1 mins walk from MTR Causeway Bay!
description:
Modern, renovated unit in the heart of Causeway Bay. Stay in the middle of every convenience, pleasure and amenity HK has to offer: the MTR station, Times Square, Hysan Place, Fashion Walk, SOGO & hundreds of restaurants are all right by the building! You're also steps away from Victoria Park, the largest outdoor space on HK Island!

The space
The unit includes:
- high speed WiFi
- 1 double bed and 1 single bed, bedding and all linens
- Fully equipped bathroom (shampoo, hair dryer etc.)
- TV

Guest access
You may access the facilities and amenities in room(air conditioner,wifi, electric water heater, locker), the hallway (hairdryer, fridge)and the common area(including microwave oven, toaster, drinking water machine, iron, electric sockets and etc).

Other things to note
You may grab a fresh towel for 20hkd deposit each in the reception;
Adapters are also available for the same deposit fee.
neighborhood_overview: We are located at the heart of Causeway Bay with Wellcome supermarket, Pacific Coffee or Starbucks Coffee, Sogo and Time Square, restaurants, banks, Post Office, laundry shop and metro station all in walking distance of 3-7 minutes.
host_about:
Dear guests,

Being a traveler for past few years, I was a fans of home-stay style. Very glad to share my properties with you in Hong Kong!

I am doing long term rental. Sometimes, the calendar is not very accurate because of too many sources for bookings. Just let me know how many people and the booking date is fine : ) 

We will send the occupancy guide with all the details to you once accepted your booking. No worries : D

Let's joining us for home-stay!

Espace Elastique (pronounced É›spas elastic) consists of a B&B, boutique hotel style accommodation and a cafÃ¨ in Tai O on Lantau Island, Hong Kong's largest and most unspoiled outlying island. Lantau is an off-track destination for those who look to escape to an alternative Hong Kong.

"Being elegantly simple" is our attitude. Our company's mission is to help sustain Tai O's crude beauty by offering our guests a comfortable home from home so that they will have time to explore and appreciate this charming traditional fishing village.

name: "Lotus"-Zen styled room @Espace Elastique of Tai O
description:
Our property is a hidden gem on green Lantau, off the beaten track far away from noisy HK center. Choose among our four modern rooms each equipped with amenities designed to suit various needs; from single to group travelers. Unmatched tranquility!

The space
Lotus Roomâ€”annex of the Family Suite

With a touch of Zen, the Lotus Room constitutes a flexible living area of the Family Suite. The space is unconstrained by furniture and has a wall fitted with mirrors and even complete with a shower room and toilet. When only Lotus Room is required, it shall be screened off by lockable top to bottom screen doors.

The semi-roomâ€™s wooden partition is not sound proof but to a certain degree helps keep privacy. It is suitable for budget travelers who are adaptable to simplistic hard bedding.

Guest access
Access to the dining area (cafe) on the ground floor is limited to breakfast time till 5 pm on weekdays and 6 pm on weekend.
neighborhood_overview: The property is ideally situated in the more tranquil  and less densely built part of Tai O village. It is only 10 minutes' walk from the bus terminus.

ABOUT THIS PROPERTY
Escape the chaos and noisy streets of Hong Kong in this lovely 3 bedroom apartment in amazing Discovery Bay, Hong Kong. This comfortabl
neighborhood_overview: Discovery Bay is an awesome kids and dogs friendly beach-side community with 2 great plazas featuring great restaurants and cafes. It has a lot of nice hiking trails for those who love the nature to discover.
host_about:
I love to travel, understand cultures and get to know people from all around the world. I admire great art and music. Love jazz in particular and trying to play some too. Watching documentaries and movies are some of my best way to relax when I am not working, planning my next trip or self-learning spanish! Great food is a necessary comfort in life - I mean...what's better than having great food and wine chilling out with best friends...?

Life Motto:
One usually regret what they didn't do in life; Not what they have done.
At least I am better than who I was yesterday.
Ask 3 questions at the end of each day and mini progresses build the big one: What I have learnt? What I have enjoyed? What I have contributed to?

name: BIG 3BR APT IN WANCHAI, HEART OF HK
description:
The space
Nicely furnished 3 bedrooms apartment in the heart of Wanchai makes you experiencing the spirit and convenience of life in Hong Kong.

Excellent location
- To/from airport : 55 minutes by bus A11 (HK$40) or 75 minutes by bus E11 (HK$21), 30 minutes by airport express (HK$100), 45 minutes by taxi (HK$300)
- 15 minutes to Ocean Park by bus
- 10 minutes to Lan Kwai Fong, Central by MTR
- 1 MTR station to Time Square, Causeway Bay or 10-15 mins on foot
- 2 MTR stations to Central, Financial District
- 2 stations to Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon
- 3 minutes walk to fresh vegetable & fruit market, laundry, massage & bar street in Wanchai

We are on the intersect of Hennessey Road and Fleming Road, just 40 metres from the Wanchai MTR exit A1, or 30 metres from the airport bus stop. Convenience stores, pubs and bars, restaurants, supermarkets, grocery stores, pharmacies, massage salons, hair salons, fruit

name: Creative Residence in Kowloon . WM
description:
The hub where Hong Kongâ€™s creative scene starts its day; a unique, diverse living space in the heart of Sham Shui Po that boasts eleven stories of artists, journalists, musicians, designers, teachers, comedians, curators and wing chun disciples.

The space
The Space

A creatives' hub filled with vintage furniture and cultured magazines, the hostel has a spacious 1000sqft bedroom apartment with a lot of surprises to be found through the details.

Our communal kitchen which is also a small cinema, selected record store and gallery.

Patio next to the bedroom for chilling and smoking.

Prebooked breakfast served each morning until 1pm

Free Wi-Fi internet access throughout the house

Creative, cultured travelers could enjoy meeting other artists-in-residence who actually live upstairs and learn more about local culture by speaking to the friendly reception. Please let us know if there is anything else we can
neighborhood_overview: 30 creative studios where they actually live there. With a combination of different workshops, you will never be bored.

neighborhood_overview:
Surrounding facilities and entertainment
If you love Hong Kong local culture, you must try here.

1. Temples street is a night market which you can see there are many peddlers selling fashion, art-craft, souvenir...

2. There is a famous cinematheque nearby which shows many characteristic movies which you must love them. Famous Hong Kong Asian Film Festival is held there once a year.

3. Convenience stores, laundry, supermarket, grocery stores, pharmacy, massage salons, fruit shops, post office, flight ticket agencies, cafe, bank, bus stops...... Easy access to everything may need in the neighborhood.

4. You are very safe because there is a police station nearby. :)

name: Sharing the sofa of a local family. (Female only)
description:
You will live with a 3 pax family in a residential area called Hung Shui Kiu, it's somewhere between Tuen Mun and Yuen Long. There's a couch in the living room that opens up in to a queen size bed.

The space
I believe expectation management is important in enjoying every trip, so here are the main problems that I want to highlight:

1. Female only.
2. There's one couch that opens up as a queen size bed in the living room. We need to walk past you when we go to the kitchen; parents usually watch TV in the living room when they're home so it would be a courtesy if you can leave some space for them during day time.
3. My parents are devoted Buddhists so there is 24 hour Buddhist chanting in house, together with the altar light which can't be switched off.
4. Hung Shui Kiu is nowhere near the central.
6. No smoking or alcohol or pets in house.
7. I don't have spare keys so please come back by midnight.
8. No extra gu
neighborhood_overview: A quiet residential area.  Restaurants and supermarkets available in 10-15 mins walk.
host_about:
I'm a traveller! Graduated in 2009, worked for 5 years and travelled for 1.5years.  Hoping to own a hostel some day.  Love travelling more than everything else.  Usually travel on budget and enjoy knowing the locals more than just taking photos of the touristic sights.  Hosted a few fellow travelers and being hosted by super friendly people around the world many times. Now I know how guests feel and know what a host should do to make guests enjoy their stay.

I like reading, writing blogs, sharing travel experience & tips, making new friends & having fun with them.
neighbourhood: Hong Kong, New Territories, Hong Kong

T
neighborhood_overview:
Made internationally famous by the 1960 film The World of Suzie Wong, historic Wan Chai is not just Hong Kongâ€™s party district; by day itâ€™s a pleasant neighbourhood for wandering and shopping.
Dotted along Queen's Road East are a number of excellent rattan and Chinese furniture shops that will happily arrange to have your purchases sent home for you or, for competitively priced clothing, try Spring Garden Lane where stalls offload garments originally earmarked for export. Techies wonâ€™t complain about getting lost in the Wanchai Computer Centre on Hennessy Road; a building jam-packed with hardware, software, accessories and other gadgets. And both kids and â€˜kidultsâ€™ might want to check out Tai Yuen Street; an entire strip of toys touting everything from the latest to the classics.
host_about:
I am a two-kids mother. I lived and worked in Hong Kong.
Every year I'll travel to different cities.
I look forward to meeting you and sharing advice and recommendation about this wonderful city.

name: Twin bed room for budget travellers
description:
The space
The apartment located in the heart of Kowloon - Monkok. You only take a 5 minutes walk to the nearby Monkok Subway Station E1 exit, A21 Airport shuttle Bus stop, and 10 minutes walk to the CTS HK-Canton (China) bus terminal. Transportation is also convenient to the 2 amusement parks - Disneyland and the Oceanpark and other sightseeing points.

The famous shopping mall Langham Place located just at the back . The Ladies Street(night market), Sportswear Street, Gold fish Street are located in east nearby. Over 100 eastern and western food restaurants can be found in the surroundings where you can relish a wide variety of local, regional and international cuisines. You can buy whatever you want in the apartment nearby, such as visual and video products, watches and jewwllery, computer parts, fashion and etc.

Room provides
1. Independent washroom with Shampoo, liquid soap, towel, toilet paper, toothbrush and tooth paste,cold and hot

name: Hong Kong - Great views/Location!
description:
Completely booked through Dec 2020. Not available for professional video rentals.

The space
Located on the south side of Hong Kong Island, the natural beauty is a surprise to most people who envision Hong Kong as only a bustling city. The south side of Hong Kong Island has the best of both worlds; beautiful island setting within easy reach to the heart of one of the most international city in the world!

A beautiful 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom apartment with STUNNING views of the south china sea. Our apartment sits on the water's edge. We are a 10 minute walking distance (or $3 US dollar taxi ride) to the village of Stanley, where you can buy anything you need, or choose to eat at Asian, European, or Western restaurants. We are also located on a bus line that will take you directly to the center of Hong Kong, by way of a Double Decker bus, in about 20-30 minutes. The south side of Hong Kong Island is truly beautiful, and we are within walking distance to
neighborhood_overview: We do NOT allow professional shooting rentals. Please do not contact us about video production rentals.
host_location: Stanley, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
host_about: We are experienced world travelers,with 3 children age 14-18. We have had many successful home exchanges and have rented our apartment through Airbnb.  We are offering our home for rent while we are traveling.  Before we will confirm a rental, we will need to speak with you directly.  We will only do financial transactions through Airbnb. We will do what we can to ensure that you will enjoy our home and Hong Kong. Our best to you.

name: STUDIO with ROOF in HEART of SOHO
description:
Charming and QUIET studio in one of the most popular areas of Soho called Prince's Terrace. Located right along the Central escalator, the studio is minutes away from great restaurants, shops, galleries, yoga studios, and gyms.

The space
Charming studio in one of the most popular areas of Soho called Prince's Terrace. Located right along the Central escalator, the studio is minutes away from great restaurants, shops, galleries, yoga studios, and gyms. Prince's Terrace itself is lined by nail parlour, art galleries and charming cafes.

The studio is furnished with a Queen size mattress on a Japanese tatami storage platform. Around the sleeping area are large top-hung windows looking out to a lovely tree that embraces the apartment and the roof.

Other features include: Nice spacious bathroom with bathtub. Cool/warm A/C system. Open closet. Pantry with water filter, mini oven/toaster, and conduction hob. Plasma TV, DVD, and wifi.
neighborhood_overview: Prince's Terrace is a heritage site in Hong Kong.  It's one of the very few terraces of this kind lined with mostly low-rise apartment building.  Although it's accessible only on foot, you can be dropped of on Caine Road to walk up or on Mosque Street to walk down to the terrace.
host_about: I am an architect, artist, designer, and yoga teacher in Hong Kong and I look forward to hosting and meeting you!

- Travel by public transport is convenient and efficient - 5 minutes walk from T.S.T MTR Exit B2 & Jordan MTR station Exit D.

- Knutsford Terrace / TST shopping district very close.

- Nearest supermarkets - 2 minute walk away (Wellcome supermarket open till midnight) 24 hour 7/11s and other convienience stores

- Nearest Laundry 20 second walk away from entrance - well priced and reliable. Collectable within half a day.

- A great vibe in the area where you'll find really authentic Korean, Japanese, Vietnamese, Western and, of course Chinese food. Chungking Mansions is also close-by with the Indian restaurants.

name: Cozy Apartment in Wan Chai
description:
The space
Located in the quiet residential area of Wan Chai, you can gain easy access to Wan Chai MTR or Admiralty MTR station.

The apt has fully equipped kitchen, living room, walk in closet and independent master bedroom . There are 3 air-conditioners: walk in closet, living room, bedroom.
The apartment was just finished renovated, furnished and decorated with a full on bathroom and shower. Additional 2 persons can settle on a sofa bed in the living room.
high speed Internet connection available.
The apartment building is very close to restaurants, super market and famous bar PAWN. you can enjoy your dinner out just taking a walk to famous Star Street, populated by funky restaurants. Enjoy nightlife in LKF district and be back home with a 30 HKD taxi ride.

name: Japanese style in Sai Ying Pun
description:
Update Apr. 2017: now equipped with Apple TV!
Update Feb 2017: all windows are now equipped with wooden blinds ensuring better privacy and light isolation.

Small, yet nice and tidy japanese style apartment in the heart of Sai Ying Pun district.
With 2 BR (2 matress 180x120), it can easily fits a couple with up to 2 child or up to 1 couple+1 adult. Located on the 10th floor with 2 elevators!
I do NOT accept visit prior to booking.
Pls note that it is not managed by a professional agency.

The space
My apartment is small (29m2) yet you will never find a place with so much space in HK!
It can easily accommodates a couple with children or 3 adults (4 even... maybe...).

The 2 rooms and the living room have sliding doors and raised wooden floor (hence the japanese style!) which can be opened to stow suitcases and luggages.
You will also find many closets in the 2 bedrooms.

The main bedroom can accommod
neighborhood_overview:
Sai Ying Pun baby!
If you draw a square between Eastern street, Second street, Western street and High street, you will get what is often branded as the new Soho of HK island!
Back in 2012, it was only just a few expats and garages to repair your Mercedes...
Today, it is all about restaurants and import-food shops (and a vintage style fitness centre).
Fortunately it still retain a bit of its local/chinese atmosphere and it is way more quiet than Soho is!

Restaurant wise: just down my place, you have a french Rotisserie with the best roasted chickens in HK!
Go up a few meters on Centre Street and you will find the Jaspas, great place to have your brunches or others Australian specialties.
Looking for something more sophisticated or just nice place to have a drink on friday evening? Continue on Centre Street - or take the new escalators if you are lazy (the slowest ones in the world!) - and you will reach High street and the french restaurant
host_about:
In Asia for more than 10 years, I have lived in mainland China (Shenzhen), Singapore and Hong Kong.
It has always been a dream to have my own place in Hong Kong and now that is the case! What a better way now to share this dream with others!

name: â¤â¤SuperHost's Private Bedroom on HK Island @TinHau
description:
It is a quiet bedroom with a double bed, and a personal refrigerator, located just over 200 meters walking distance from the Tin Hau MTR Station's Exit A1. From my door... Causeway Bay Shopping District is 10 minutes walk, Hung Hom/TST is 10-15 minutes away by bus or MTR, and Central is only a 12-minute MTR Ride. Our guests are always pleasantly surprised with the convenience of our location. My flat is situated within minutes of food, transportation, and cultural temples!!!

The space
Your room is a simple 1-2 person guest bedroom with a personal refrigerator, bed, chest, and a wardrobe. I always supply clean sheets, towels, and a cheery attitude. The wardrobe has ample room for your luggage, and the refrigerator is perfect for drinks/snacks.

I can accommodate an additional person if needed, but there is an extra charge.

Within 200 meters are the famous Hong Kong Tram and multiple bus routes that can take you to the Peak, TST, o
neighborhood_overview:
At the street level below my home are multiple restaurants, dessert stores, fruit sellers, meat vendors, and convenience stores. Tin Hau/Tai Hang is known for being the place to find a wide variety of food, which would explain the multiple BMW's, Audi's, Ferrari's, etc. always parked during the evenings.

Around Tin Hau/Tai Hang:
Large choice of restaurants: Chinese, Japanese Ramen or Sushi, Vietnamese, Thai, Indian, Korean, Italian, Fast food, CafÃ© (Local or 3 different Starbucks, and a Pacific Coffee), Sweets
Grocery: 7/11 (45 seconds), Supermarkets (Wellcome or International) (1 min)
Others: Massage (1 min), Drugstore (1 min), Laundry shop (3 min), Victoria Park (3 min), Swimming pool (2 min), Basketball (3 min)

In the case that you have an evening departure flight:
Please note that you can check in your luggage at any time during the same day as your flight at the Hong Kong Station Airport Express, which is only a 5-minute taxi or
host_about:
"I am a lover, a dreamer, a believer of magic. I bought the copyrights on the fantasy of living happily ever after despite the monumental efforts of the real world to protect me from myself. I have taken every chance I have had to wonder. Perhaps it was 'wonder why I do this' or 'wonder when lunch is' but mostly it has been taking a big bite of the juiciness and letting it dribble down my chin kind of wondering. I laugh longer, cry louder, and dream deeper than ever before in my life and I wouldn't exchange a bit of the pain for a day of life inside the lines." 

I am an upbeat outgoing person, with a passion for Inline Skating , as well as, Snow/Water Skiing, working out, rock climbing, cycling,... anything keeping me active. There is always a little kid in me saying "Act your shoe size, not your age." Very passionate about things that I believe in, Always working to grow as a person and to learn to not take "life" for granted, I like to read books promoting self-awareness. I also love to cook, just lay around sometimes, or get outdoors and work up a sweat. I work to LIVE, not live to WORK - I define myself not by my job, but by what I get pleasure in. Living for the moment, I enjoy each breath of fresh air, and try to not take life too seriously.
neighbourhood: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

The space
One fully furnished bedroom with a double bed available in my flat.

- 30mins by train to the city centre.
- Supermaket, 711, ATMs, fresh market, provision stores and nepalese/indian/chinese restos surround the area all within a 100m distance.
- Flat is fully equipped with furniture, wifi, TV (no cable but netflix available) gas and a private rooftop (with BBQ grill and patio furniture) and balcony for amazing mountain view.

NB: Place is ideal for someone who loves the suburbs and not too hyped about being in the crowded city. Nice historical architecture and mountain trails surround the apartment. Very welcoming mixed community and peaceful atmosphere.

name: Wanchai Pigeon Burrow â€” Studio Flat
description:
A tiny studio apartment all to yourself in the heart of Hong Kong. One block from MTR, major bus routes, tram, and taxi services. Walk 15 minutes to the HK Convention Center. Owner lives nearby.

A small spot in an excellent location.

- Wanchai Pigeon Burrow

The space
A tiny (150 sqft) private apartment located in a walk-up building near Wanchai's wet market (food market). Conveniently located in the heart of Hong Kong within one block of the MTR light rail station and a stone's throw from major bus routes, trams, and taxi services. Everything, and I mean everything, is at your doorstep.

Expect convenience and a no-nonsense place to spend the night in Hong Kong. The apartment is a tight fit, but if you're looking for a place to rest during your time here - look no further. Your own door and key - come and go at your own convenience.

The apartment includes:
- single / twin size bed (1.0m x 2.0m) â€” groups will be shar
neighborhood_overview:
Wanchai, the very heart of Hong Kong, is home to primarily two things - office buildings and a rather seedy nightlife. The area also boasts easy and direct transportation to almost all areas of Hong Kong SAR.

FOOD:
Check out my Airbnb Guidebook on the listing. It is also HIGHLY recommended to download 'Open Rice' app for restaurant discovery, locations, and reviews.

NIGHTLIFE:
Wanchai has a busy nightlife scene. There is always live music going late into the night and plenty of popular clubs and bars. Take a note, however, that Wanchai also has a well-established prostitution scene consisting mostly of Filipino women trying to convince you to enter the more seedy locales.

For further nightlife a 5 minute taxi ride will take you to the famed Lan Kwai Fong "LKF" (about 30HKD by taxi, or, for the cheaper route, about 8HKD by tram) and the Central / Soho bar and club scene.

Other nightlife areas are: Star Street, Hollywood Rd, Tsim Sha
host_location: Wan Chai, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
host_about:
I am an Architect out of Seattle and Hong Kong. I have built projects in Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, and Hong Kong â€” as well as the United States.

I frequently travel and enjoy the flexibility Airbnb provides in sharing my place in Hong Kong as well experiencing others' in far away locales. I explore the world, meet people, and observe foreign cultures. I pride myself as a great host and have an eye for details. My goal is to provide the same experience as what I would expect to receive.

name: Bright quiet studio in Hong Kong Central district
description:
The space
Hi, I have a bright open view studio flat.
It's in one of the last places in Central that still has small shops and street markets. I'm on the 4th floor of a low rise, walk up building (no lift nor elevator!).
I believe in great sleep so I've got a queen size bed with a proper matress ( and an extra futon style sofa bed) and I believe in a great shower, so hot water and enough pressure (the bathroom is tiny so the toilet and shower are close together) and nice soap and shampoo.
The flat has a hot plate and some basic kitchen stuff, a small 3 in 1 breakfast maker, a washing machine, a big desk, a small fridge, a scale so you can weigh your bags, airconditioning and a ceiling fan above the bed (since I don't like aircon when I sleep) It has free high speed Wifi and a small fridge. I think that's it..oh, and I vowed to keep the Ikea level below the 10%.
Here's a clip from guests reviews.
Peters flat is located in one of the best areas i
host_about:
I'm from the Netherlands but I have been living in Hong Kong for the last 18 years. I work as a carpenter/builder/art handler and do projects all over the world. Last year my business partner Marcus and I started a rooftop and playground garden company. Our aim is to improve the life of our students and residents by changing concrete to jungle.
  I like skiing, yoga ( great stretch after a days building...) and baking and eating apple pie and muffins! As for the past... Schooled as a tailor and trained as a carpenter, I have hitch hiked from my village in Holland to Japan, took cargo ships to and from South America, taught English, Dutch and Spanish in Paraguay, tour guided in Patagonia, Bolivia and Chile for 3 years, cycled from Dehli to Hong Kong on Indian bicycles and had some more adventures in between and after.

1-bedroom cozy apartment with rooftop on the beautiful South Lantau. Away from city life and enjoy the quiet side of Hong Kong. My place is not fancy but functional if you want to experience local countryside area.

The space
One Bedroom apartment in PUI O on Lantau.

neighborhood_overview: Pui O is located on the same island of the airport but in the southern side. It takes around 50 mins by buses or 30 mins by taxi between the airport and my area. 10 mins walk to the lovely Pui O beach. There are many trails around this area and the 2nd highest mountain - Lantau Peak just right at the corner. This is the area for people who enjoy their quiet stay with the great nature surrounding in Hong Kong. You can also easily get to the big Buddha and the classic fishing village - Tai O.

neighborhood_overview: The SOHO / Central district of Hong Kong is one of the most vibrant and fun. Right outside your door will be restaurants featuring top quality cuisine from around the globe. If you desire nightlife there are a variety of bars right in SOHO, and Hong Kong's best nightclubs are only a few minute walk away. If you want to take a breather, there are hip and trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and retail shops located within a minute walking distance in Sheung Wan. If there is only one thing you can do in Hong Kong, go to The Peak. If you have many things to do here, still go to The Peak. The highest point on Hong Kong Island, this has been the cityâ€™s most exclusive neighbourhood since colonial times, you can get there in a few minutes.

name: Cozy refurbed flat, 1 min to MTR
description:
(**Price reduced**)
A refurbished 1-bed flat + rooftop in the midst of HK's most interesting locale. Brand new fittings and furnishings, great transport links, elevator and all mod cons. Don't miss out!

The space
This is a great, refurbished apartment in Sai Ying Pun, Hong Kong's coolest up-and-coming area.

We spent a lot of time, effort and love on this upgrade of an old flat, and think we succeeded. We even installed a real oven! (Rare in HK)

It's small (300 sq ft + 250 sq ft rooftop), but perfectly suitable for a single, couple or even four people, with a sofabed also available to use. There's a lounge/dining area attached to an open kitchen, a fully fitted bathroom, a bedroom and a rooftop. Our rooftop is attached to the same level of the flat, so no leaving the flat and climbing stairs to get there, unlike a lot of places in HK.

Location is a real perk - one-minute walk to HKU MTR (three stops (7-8 minutes) to Central
neighborhood_overview: From a military base where the British first set up, Sai Ying Pun is now a buzzing area popular with foodies and young folk. Check out Ping Pong bar for a great gin and tonic! There's a huge multi-story wet market around the corner, local and international restaurants, SYP's vibrant nightlife in one direction and quieter walks and the University in the other.

neighborhood_overview:
Mong Kok is one of Hong Kong's liveliest districts and includes popular markets, shopping streets, stalls and malls. The neon-bathed historic streets that wind through one of the densest parts of the world are worth visiting.

The neighbourhood includes one of Hong Kongâ€™s most popular markets, the Ladies' Market, and also has a ton of shopping streets, which are a common feature in southern China. Conveniently, these are where a cluster of merchants sell one type of product on a single street. Mong Kok has entire streets and street sections dedicated to the sale of goldfish, flowers, birds, sneakers, and kitchenware.

ãƒ»Sai Yeung Choi Street sells electronics, cosmetics and clothes.
ãƒ»Shantung Street and Dundas Street are where you can pick up the latest Japanese and Western fashion and accessories.
ãƒ»Langham Place is one of the many malls where you can do your Mong Kok shopping in air-conditioned comfort.

I am from Hong Kong, I love travelling to explore something new. I am a web-editor of a women website in HK, i also have a personal blog, and i love to share my travel experience with my readers and friends.

neighborhood_overview:
For the ones who want to leave the pollution and chaos of city behind and chill by sea breeze but still 15-20mins to city.
You can find anything you like in our neighbourhood.
Pubs, restaurants, shops selling art works, gifts, clothes and so on... Best neighbourhood to stay in Summertime and Autumn and Winter as well :) Especially with families with kids. Playground in front of building. Library across the road. Water-sport facilities just 2 minutes walk. You can rent kayaks, windsurf, boards, SUPs etc...
Very unlike the busy and chaotic city center.
Clean and breezy sea air at all times... 8-)

check in time is 2 pm and check out time 11 am. early check in and late check out is only permissible at a fee

name: Modern Studio in Central/Soho!
description:
The space
Located in the heart of Central HK, on Peel Street, in the middle of the trendy Soho area, this bright, clean and modern style studio apartment is available for rent. The appartment is fully furnished with:

-comfy double bed
-big flatscreen tv & soundsystem
-extra sofabed
-fully equiped kitchen (fridge, microwave, 2 electric stoves, washing machine, etc)
-Airconditioning
-WIFI Internet & Cable TV

This place is right in the centre of Hong Kong and has everything you need for the perfect stay. It's right in the middle of Soho (but still quite), and a 5-8 minutes walk away from the mtr, CBD and LKF. Supermarket, Seven Eleven, taxi's etc are less than 2 minutes away.

Guest access
The whole flat. Privacy please!
host_about:
We are a couple from the UK, currently living and working in Hong Kong. Joyce runs her own Interior Design Firm. We just finished renovating our first apartment, and will start with the second one soon.
In our spare time we love to hike on one of the many amazing trails Hong Kong has to offer, travel, eat and take our dog to the beach. If you have any questions about our place or HK in general, feel free to ask!

name: Neat Cozy Studio for 1-3 @ Wan Chai
description:
The space
Clean & well-equipped Studio Apt. with Ikea loft bed and pull-out sofa bed enough for 3 guests, is conveniently located in Wanchai near all transports, just 5 min walk from the bustling Time Sq. & SOGO. Bus stop from/to the A/P is next to the Bldg. Great for travelers who are looking to base from a central & convenient location to explore HK.


Equipped with refrigerator, kettle, fan, A/C and separate bathroom. Unfortunately no kitchen therefore no cooking in the apartment. However, worry not, you are in the middle of a food heaven (from 1 star price to 5 star price) with many varieties to choose from. The local neighborhood market is also just across the street for you to pick up fresh fruit and greens for a simple meal.

Towels, shower gel, shampoo, cleansing soap, laundry detergent and fabric softener are provided, all you need to bring your tooth brush and toothpaste.

You will have the entire apartment to yourself during y
neighborhood_overview: Lively neighborhood!
host_about: I love traveling whenever I could. When I do, I could relate to the desire of having a nice good night sleep in a cozy, simple, clean, private, centrally-located yet wallet-friendly accommodation at the end of each day. I would like to offer my place with the qualities  I crave as a traveler to those who desire the same.

name: Old Hong Kong charm
description:
"West is Best" is what long time residents like me say. More frantic & polluted on the Eastern part of HK island from Wanchai & beyond. If you want charm, this is the place to stay. Funky bars, alfresco dining, great transport. Minimum stay 1 nite.

The space
Mid Rise. Mainly owner occupiers. Great layout. Spacious lounge. Corner unit. Plenty of natural light.

Guest access
Great bars and restaurants in Central, a mere 10 minutes away by cab.
neighborhood_overview: CHARM.  One of the earliest and oldest neighbourhoods.
host_about: Global citizen, world traveller, Gourmet, Wine buff, Art lover. I've been travelling since I was 11 years old.  Friends  describe me as being "more fun than a barrel full of monkeys on speed". The English (the country of which I am a National) politely refer to me as "marginally eccentric". I am currently working on my book.

name: Cozy Double Rm 3 next to Jordan MTR
description:
The space
Simply Hostel is a brand new guest house providing a budget accommodation for tourists from all over the world. The hostel simply aims to bring you a feeling of coziness and happiness of your stay, let you fully enjoy your journey in Hong Kong! No matter whether you are spending your business trip or sightseeing tour here, you can feel the warm ambience of the hostel, and its simple and smart design simply makes you feel like home.

Our location (Map)
We are located in the heart of Hong Kong, at the most famous shopping street â€“ Nathan Road. The building is next to the Jordan MTR station, and it connects to the MTR exit (B1). The newly built MTR passenger lift makes you more convenient to come to us with your bulky luggage. If you take the airport bus (A22), drop off at the Jordan Road, and only take a 30-second walk to our building. The convenient location leads you to all sight-seeing spots in Tsim Sha Tsui, Yau Ma Tei, Mong Kok, Central, Wa

host_location: Wan Chai, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
host_about:
I love to meet different people and visit to other places, visiting the local farmer's market and experience and live like a local using bnb.  

I have been airbnb host since 2011 for 7 years already.  So Glad to have over 670 guest reviews!!  We work so hard to keep happy guests but only 20% of guests spend their precious time to write reviews :-)  CHEERS to all supportive new guests, return guests and referred guests.  I hope to serve you better.  Please do give us private feedback anytime and I valued your feedback and will improve my apartments.  I am so glad many of you appreciate all the hard work and bare with the occasionally 1% silly mistake / fault / defect I have made.  Thank you so much for your patient.  

Again, should you need anything during your stay, don't be shy, please do let me know via calling or email me.  I am more than happy to provide suggestion / immediate assistant / support as soon as possible.

Due to the reason that Sep-Apr is peak season, you are advised to make your reservation earlier.   I can only do first book first serve basis, where I won't cancel current booking just because other guests have a longer / bigger booking.  Due to strict cancellation policy, I haven't cancel guest booking so far, except from time to time having guest need to cancel or amend their booking due to different reason and we will considerate case by case (so far only full refund to 1 group of guest as they are able to provide document to proof that their immediate family member need emergency operation). 

Max Capacity is cater to big group consists of family n kids with standard asian size.  If group with members with huge body size or some members prefer to have a bed by their own, not sharing with other, then please split your group into two apartments for more comfortable stay.  I have tried my best to write the apartment description as detail as I could. Please spend time to read through before you book.  I am definitely happy to answer any question that is not in the apartment description.


Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made. 

Below is the FAQ on airbnb â€œWhy canâ€™t I call or email a host before booking?â€: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111

Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

name: Newly renovated, bright open 1bd apt, Sai Ying Pun
description:
This newly renovated, bright one bedroom apartment is in a lovely traditional neighbourhood, with a great village feel. The combined open kitchen and living space have a lovely outlook to Victoria Harbour. Owner occupied, and fully fitted out, it's a convenient and comfortable choice!

There's heaps of great transport options (MTR, buses, taxis), and it is also walking distance to Soho/Central.

The space
A surprising amount of space awaits in this one bed apartment. It's on the 18th floor with a nice view of Victoria Harbour and Hong Kong University.

While you don't come to Hong Kong to stay in an apartment, it's nice to have a homely and convenient place to come home to at the end of a day!

Guest access
One double room. A full size fridge and washer can be found in the kitchen, and there's a modest bathroom with shower.
neighborhood_overview: Sai Ying Pun is the talk of the town! There's a new MTR opened, and many new shops and restaurants are opening, alongside the great local places that give the area its charm.
host_about:
Hi! I'm an Aussie living in Hong Kong, by way of a few years in Beijing. I've got a cosy place in what I think is the best suburb in this city, with a charming mix of traditional and modern everything! 

I'm not sure how my apartment reflects my personality, but am sure it does! I like to keep active, exploring much of the great outdoors Hong Kong has to offer as well as enjoying the delights in my own neighbourhood. I enjoy sharing my city knowledge with others.
neighbourhood: Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong

name: Spacious homey 1BR in Central SoHo Area
description:
If wants to feel that true Hong Kong buzz, this charming 780sqf walk-up apartment is centrally located in the hip SoHo district, minutes away from the best eateries and bars in Hong Kong, and all major transportation (ferry, bus, MTR) lines.

The space
The spacious apartment has 1 available bedroom with a queen's sized bed and a super-comfy couch in the living area, which can serve as an extra bed. Fits 3 ideally.

The space is bright with lots of windows, but it also has really great "hangover" curtains, should you want it to stay dark in the mornings. The airconditioning unit in the living area is very strong and able to cool the entire apartment. Separate heating units can also be provided.

Please Note: There is no elevator in the building and this is a 4th floor walk-up, which is one of the charming parts of living in Hong Kong. Think of it as much-needed exercise after indulging in the many great meals available in the area!

E
neighborhood_overview: You can't beat the convenience of living in the heart of SoHo, Central, one of the hippest, most trendy districts in Hong Kong. You will be surrounded by the best restaurants, bars and entertainment. It is also extremely easy to access the Central Business District and is well-connected to every kind of public transport.
host_about:
Hi there, I'm Sara. I was born in Singapore, went to school in the U.S. and have now been living in Hong Kong for the past 7 years. My accent is a bit of a work of art. I love new experiences and my favourite travel destinations are warm and sunny (just like me). As a brand consultant, I am drawn to bright colours, creativity and good design, which you will see somewhat reflected in my apartment - I hope! 

My friends and I have had some great travel experiences via airbnb, staying at lovely places and interacting with even more lovely people. I do not smoke, and I am a reliable and considerate guest. Now I feel its my turn to reciprocate and contribute to the community by being an equally reliable and considerate host. I'm happy to share my local knowledge on food, shopping, parties, sights etc - ask me anything!
neighbourhood: Central, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, Hong Kong

Max Capacity is cater to big group consists of family n kids with standard asian size.  If group with members with huge body size or some members prefer to have a bed by their own, not sharing with other, then please split your group into two apartments for more comfortable stay.  I have tried my best to write the apartment description as detail as I could. Please spend time to read through before you book. host_about:
I love to meet different people and visit to other places, visiting the local farmer's market and experience and live like a local using bnb.  

I have been airbnb host since 2011 for 7 years already.  So Glad to have over 670 guest reviews!!  We work so hard to keep happy guests but only 20% of guests spend their precious time to write reviews :-)  CHEERS to all supportive new guests, return guests and referred guests.  I hope to serve you better.  Please do give us private feedback anytime and I valued your feedback and will improve my apartments.  I am so glad many of you appreciate all the hard work and bare with the occasionally 1% silly mistake / fault / defect I have made.  Thank you so much for your patient.  

Again, should you need anything during your stay, don't be shy, please do let me know via calling or email me.  I am more than happy to provide suggestion / immediate assistant / support as soon as possible.

name: Spacious studio in heart of SoHo
description:
This large studio in the heart of Soho has everything you need for you stay in Hong Kong. Next to the Central escalator, it's only a 5 minutes walk to LKF and all of Hong Kong's CBD.With convenient access to MTR and major bus and tram lines.

The space
The apartment is a well appointed studio that fits 2 people comfortably, any more people than that and I make no guarantees to your comfort level. There's a large kitchen with all the basics and a large, modern bathroom (a rarity in Hong Kong.)
There's a lot of storage, a very big closet with enough space for all your clothes and more. Also, the bed lifts up to reveal more storage for your luggage or anything else you want to keep out of the way.
But what really makes the apartment special is the neighborhood. SoHo and the neighboring Sheung Wan are thriving communities with an eclectic array of restaurants, coffee shops and boutiques from local owners. And it's just a few minutes to all the large stores
neighborhood_overview:
SoHo consists of restaurants, bars, nightclubs, art galleries and antique stores of Staunton Street and Elgin Street.
The area has a rich contrast between past and present and makes for great sightseeing on foot. This district treads a precarious balance between preserving the Chinese and colonial cultures that shaped it, and recent modern developments.

name: Modern Large Studio , Heart of city
description:
The space
This is really what experiencing Hong Kong is all about. This studio apartment is in the heart of Wan Chai, a district stepped in tradition and sandwiched between Central, the heart of Asia's financial capital and Causewaybay, a true symbol of why Hong Kong is considered a Shoppers' Paradise.

Taxi's, Buses, Trams, Underground transport are all within 3 minute walking distance. The view of this apartment is a breathtaking site of one of Hong Kong's most treasured historical grade sites, the Blue House (easily found through search engines). The area is quickly being transformed with an infusion of art galleries, new world class eateries and bars that take advantage of the city young longing to enjoy the traditional part of the city while also enjoying the exciting vibe happening around the area.

This open studio has a large double bed and a nice lounge sofa PLUS:

1) FREE ultra high speed wireless and LAN internet,
2) Full K
host_about:
I've enjoyed traveling to different parts of the world my entire life and absolutely love meeting locals at each place I visit to get first hand knowledge of the destination.  I've made many friends across the globe and look forward to visiting them each time I'm back in the region.  I've called Hong Kong my home for the past 30 years, this is absolutely a brilliant little place with so much local flavor and western influences in this Chinese city.  I look forward to meeting lots of overseas friends and pointing out the many local favorites so every visitor has a chance to experience the best of this great city.
Happy travels!

Free - Super fast internet wifi (HKBN)

The space
This comfortable apartment has a separate lounge room/ bedroom, and is perfect for single travelers or a couple.

host_about:
My Personal Brief Description:
1. Positive Girl, always think optimistic. 
2. On schedule, always follow what I have planned and acheived 
3. Helpful, Always help others and be volunteer 
4. Considerate, always think of other people's feeling 
5. Passionate, once I devote to join and do a task, I will enjoy and actively participate
6. Keep on learning, I am studying property management and Korean 

My Philosophy:
Enjoy life, enjoy helping others. I study Economics and learn oppotunity cost. But to me, money ( enjoy working by my hands rather money fall into my pocket) and leisure must get a balance. Maybe this is easy to foreigner, but in HK, enjoy work-life balance is really hard to get. Many people live under average, if everyone can offer few hours up to few days to do voluntary work, the world will be different - and some people will get changed because of YOU :)
Know well about Hong Kong, Macau, now live in Dubai.

name: Harbour Mong kok Renovated Room 2
description:
The space
ROOM DESCRIPTION:
- Newly renovated
- South facing
- LED TV
- Water heater
- Free WIFI
- Air conditioning
- 24 hrs security

LOCATION:
Located between Mong kok and Yau ma tei, this apartment building is surrounded by various large scale shopping malls, restaurants, upscale hotels and office buildings. The picturesque view of Victoria Harbor is visible from here and nearby attractions includes the Tsim Sha Tsui clock tower, Hong Kong cultural centre (the place favored by local young couples to have their wedding ceremony)

ACCESIBILITY
Located outside Mong kok E1 exit, getting around Hong Kong is extremely convenient given the central location. Approximate travel time to Disney land is roughly 30 minutes by train. A 5 minutes walk will take you to the Star Ferry, the shortest ferry ride in the world.

host_location: Wan Chai, Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong
host_about:
I love to meet different people and visit to other places, visiting the local farmer's market and experience and live like a local using bnb.  

I have been airbnb host since 2011 for 7 years already.  So Glad to have over 670 guest reviews!!  We work so hard to keep happy guests but only 20% of guests spend their precious time to write reviews :-)  CHEERS to all supportive new guests, return guests and referred guests.  I hope to serve you better.  Please do give us private feedback anytime and I valued your feedback and will improve my apartments.  I am so glad many of you appreciate all the hard work and bare with the occasionally 1% silly mistake / fault / defect I have made.  Thank you so much for your patient.  

Again, should you need anything during your stay, don't be shy, please do let me know via calling or email me.  I am more than happy to provide suggestion / immediate assistant / support as soon as possible.

*********************************************************************************
FOR NEW airbnb user, below are some of the FAQ links for your perusal (questions & answers useful for new user). Please do let me know if you have any problem, my response would be faster than airbnb support team as sometimes their hotline as very busy (but I only can help you on general question).

GENERAL FAQ for guests before booking 
www.airbnb.com/help/topic/traveling

FAQ: What are Airbnb Service Fees? 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/104

FAQ: For How to Book 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/85

FAQ: For How to make a payment / reservation 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/126

FAQ: For How to Contact Airbnb Support 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/9

FAQ: How and when do I make a payment for my reservation? 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/92

FAQ: How can I view or print a billing receipt or itinerary for my trip? 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/100

FAQ: How are cleaning fees added? 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/58

FAQ: How does the Airbnb payment system work? 
www.airbnb.com/help/question/51

We strongly recommend reviewing all cancellation policies before making your reservations: www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies?guest_fee_policy=grace_period_48_hours#strict-with-grace

FAQ: When do I pay for my long-term reservation?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/245

Due to the reason that Sep-Apr is peak season, you are advised to make your reservation earlier.   I can only do first book first serve basis, where I won't cancel current booking just because other guests have a longer / bigger booking.  Due to strict cancellation policy, I haven't cancel guest booking so far, except from time to time having guest need to cancel or amend their booking due to different reason and we will considerate case by case (so far only full refund to 1 group of guest as they are able to provide document to proof that their immediate family member need emergency operation). 

Max Capacity is cater to big group consists of family n kids with standard asian size.  If group with members with huge body size or some members prefer to have a bed by their own, not sharing with other, then please split your group into two apartments for more comfortable stay.  I have tried my best to write the apartment description as detail as I could. Please spend time to read through before you book.  I am definitely happy to answer any question that is not in the apartment description.


Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made. 

Below is the FAQ on airbnb â€œWhy canâ€™t I call or email a host before booking?â€: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111

Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

Located between Mong kok and Yau ma tei, this apartment building is surrounded by various large scale shopping malls, restaurants, upscale hotels and office buildings. The picturesque view of Victoria Harbor is visible from here and nearby attractions includes the Tsim Sha Tsui clock tower, Hong Kong cultural centre (the place favored by local young couples to have their wedding ceremony)

ACCESIBILITY
Located outside Mong kok E1 exit, getting around Hong Kong is extremely convenient given the central location. Approximate travel time to Disney land is roughly 30 minutes by train. A 5 minutes walk will take you to the Star Ferry, the shortest ferry ride in the world.

description:
The space
Room Description:
Recently renovated with brand new furnishings, this room comes equipped with:

- Double bed (6ft x 4ft)
- HD TV in living room
- 24/7 security and security cameras in apartment building

A professional team will disinfect after every group of guest leaves.


Location:
This room is located in the heart of Mong Kok, right next to the MTR train station.

Lang-ham Shopping Mall, an award winning 15-storey fashion landmark of the Kowloon District is just across the road from this apartment building.

Looking for bargain? The Ladies Street Bazaar will give you a myriad of choices from local handicrafts to quirky accessories for your gadgets. Don't be shy to haggle when you are there!

If you venture further north into ladies street, you will probably find yourself in Goldfish Street, which is famous for none other than live goldfishes.

The space
Stunning studio in Central! Walking distance to everything. Everything is included in this condo. No need to log furniture and utensils to yet another new place when you'll only be there for a short while. Come stay in one of Hong Kongâ€™s nicest listings!

Other things to note

Apologize for that as I have many rooms and there are many bookings a day. Donâ€™t worry, yes, I do
neighborhood_overview: The SOHO / Central district of Hong Kong is one of the most vibrant and fun. Right outside your door will be restaurants featuring top quality cuisine from around the globe. If you desire nightlife there are a variety of bars right in SOHO, and Hong Kong's best nightclubs are only a few minute walk away. If you want to take a breather, there are hip and trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and retail shops located within a minute walking distance in Sheung Wan. If there is only one thing you can do in Hong Kong, go to The Peak. If you have many things to do here, still go to The Peak. The highest point on Hong Kong Island, this has been the cityâ€™s most exclusive neighbourhood since colonial times, you can get there in a few minutes.

name: Modern Self-Contained Studio in LKF Central.
description:
Nestled in the famous Lan Kwai Fong area in Central - the beating heart of Hong Kong - you can't get better location than this!

This modern studio has everything you need for a great stay in HK. Comfy queen bed, fully equipped kitchenette, even a washer-dryer. Super popular amongst both short & long term guests - whether you're here for a solo citybreak, couple getaway, or a biz trip!

Delicious local diners, Michelin starred restaurants, amazing cafes all at your door step. 5min to MTR.

The space
Located in the beating heart of LKF Central, this self-contained studio is the perfect showcase of optimised compact city-living in Hong Kong (in a cosy 150 sqft apt) !

The living / sleeping space comes with a comfy queen sized bed and a large wardrobe. A drop-leaf desk is perfect for those who need to do a bit of work from home during their stay. We've also installed cable TV with plenty of local and international news and movies channe
neighborhood_overview:
Location, location, location! You can't get better location than this cosy little gem in Hong Kong. The studio is located inside an apartment block with over 40 years history, a neighbourly building that survived amidst a rapidly gentrifying jungle of new high-rises.

A little square located in the heart of the Central business district of Hong Kong, Lan Kwai Fong (LKF) is a little stretch comprises of uphill cobbled streets - home to over 100 restaurants and bars. A nightlife hotspot for locals and expats alike, this is the perfect place to start your HK trip whatever you are in the mood for. A hearty bowl of wonton noodle? Head to Tsim Chai Kee. A glass of champagne at a roof-top bar? CÃ‰ LA VI is just across the road. Dinner at a 3-starred Michelin restaurant? There are 4 within 10 min walk away. Or a cup of award-winner coffee to wake up after an overnight flight? Head downstairs to Coffee Academics

We regularly update our guidebook with recommendations on plac
host_about:
We moved to Hong Kong from London in summer 2013, and this incredible city has been our home ever since. Ryan is from London and Krystal is originally from Hong Kong.

We both run our own businesses and travel regularly for our jobs and for leisure of course! Blessed with the proximity to other fantastic places nearby, we have been busy travelling extensively around Asia ever since we arrived in HK, including Tibet, Nepal, Cambodia, Vietnam, Thailand, Singapore, Malaysia, Japan, Bali etc. We will be more than happy to share travel tips if any guests are making a trip to other Asian countries too!

In our spare time, we enjoy going on the many fantastic hikes in HK, sipping iced tea and cold beer on the beach, yoga, jazz, good coffee, a good book, and spending time with our furry friends Lola & Rosie. 

You may also meet our lovely helper Jay (she's is from Philippine and enjoys volleyball and table tennis!), who helps us out when we are not around.

When we travel abroad we always use Airbnb. For us, a clean, comfortable and safe place to stay is essential. This is exactly what we offer to any guests staying with us. We hope that our place will be a little home-away-from-home for you during your time in HK.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Krystal and Ryan
